page.title: 13Bramhope: Housing 1
page.content: Bramhope's status as an affluent residential area favoured by business, and professional people is directly related to its superior quality housing,almost all of which is privately owned.The village's oldest cottages,farmhouses and short terraces are substantially built of Yorkshire stone.Some houses,like The Smithy, exhibit interesting evidence of their past usage.Others reveal their age on wall inscriptions dating from 1671 onwards.The first 20th century housing development consisted of large individual houses,generally standing in extensive gardens.Such properties have often been modernised,and some now feature,{swimming pools}and {tennis courts.}Where recent private infilling has taken place,these houses also support the luxurious image.
